reviewText:
In my opinion the best cooperative survival horror game besides Left 4 Dead.
Team play is the key in this title and working together always makes the game more interesting.
The game has a good level system, seven different classes (perks) and ten different types of enemies (specimens). You can choose between five difficulties from easy up to Hell on Earth".
An awesome feature of Killing Floor are the special events like the "Twisted Christmas Event" or the "Summer Sideshow Event" where all creatures in game will be temporarily re-skinned.

Sound 8/10
Graphic 7/10
Gameplay 10/10
Atmosphere 10/10

If you liked my review

reviewText:
An instant zombie classic. This game brought me together with many friends and introduced me to many other awesome gamers who like to kill zombies. Games can range from short - long, lasting 4 waves - 10 waves, with a Patriarch boss getting his own wave at the end. Similar to L4D, except gameplay is wave based not objective based. However there is an objective play mode with a few maps that are fun as well.

From your basic zombie (referred to as ZEDs in this game) to the intimidating Fleshpound and Scrake, there are many different special zombie types who will all try to eat you in different ways.

There are 7 perk types to play as, from the melee Berserker, to the Medic, to the Sharpshooter, there is likely a class you will really enjoy playing.

Play solo or with a group up to 6, and on custom servers upwards of 30 players on one server.

Many players have created custom maps or objective modes that are unique and fun to play, aside from the 30~ish regular maps, if you like killing zombies, this game can get addicting.

There are 5 difficulty levels, and starting out you really should play on 1/5 - Beginner, because as you level your perks (which level to 6 ((higher on custom servers))) you will become stronger with those weapon types and gain necessary benefits to damage and survival that you need to have for higher difficulties.

After 700~ hours, I've completed all but a handful of maps on 4/5 diff - Suicidal. It's extremely challenging and 5/5 diff is even more ridiculous. If you're good at FPS you will get the hang of it, but like any game, this one in particular takes time and practice.

A great game to play with friends as well, the more perk types your team can cover the better chances you have of surviving, although it is possible to solo most difficulties with any perk, some are more challenging than others. Each perk has a role that they perform and zombies they should focus on taking out, teamwork is key and if you are a lone wolf you can stick with solo.

Still fun after years of playing it. Up there with L4D.

reviewText:
Spectacular Cooperative Shooter Zombie game! Its filled with tons of exciting new contents every Summer, Halloween and Christmas! Perks are classes and there are only 6 Player classes mean you can easily adjust your playing style if its not working. Slashing your way with a melee weapon as a Berserker, burning the Specimens as a Firebug, you want to blow some explosives? sure you can be a Demolition! You want to do some headshots, pistols or sniping? Be a Sharpshooter! You can mow them down using a Shotgun or Wield the door to trap your teammates as a Support Specialist! Tired of not seeing Stalkers, want to see how much of any specimens have health bar left? lead your comrades to victorious? be a Commando! Lastly, are you in a pain that your teammates is always dying in the middle of the fight and you really want to help them and heal them? be a Field Medic!

There are lots of fire arms in this game regarding DLC's weapons, tag along with your friends to battle in the open field map, fending off against the specimens horde until the Patriarch appeared in the last hour...

Rated: 9.5/10

Much fun, recommended, good chance to grab it when a special offer is up.

reviewText: Killing Floor suffers from lack of polish, but does resemble a fairly decent coop survival shooter with subtle RPG elements. The game fundamentals are solid even with the lack of continuity by chasing down a trader for gun and ammo purchases between hordes of zombies. For casual players, the RPG elements are much too serious a grind to reach maximum level. The developers continue to put time and effort into keeping the game popular and fun with sales events and new DLC. It's not all that fun to play by yourself, but certainly plenty of entertainment for you and your mates together.

reviewText:
Killing Floor is a decent Zombie style game with a wide variety of character perks, or professions to choose fro. It also has a LOT of different maps to play as well as different difficulty levels to choose from. Killing Floor has well over 250 achievements to get, with about half of them being map based. So if your playing a map say, called Forgotten, you can play that Forgotten map on Normal for an achievement, then, on Hard for an achievement as well as Suicidal and Hell of Earth diffculties for achievements. Alot of achievements in the game ! The Character perks can be slow going, but its up to you to find a map that is easy to master and spam that map over and over to get your Characters up as fast as you want. Some are easy to do, others are slow and painful. You can set up a listening server and have up to 5 friends join your server. This will increase the amount of enemies that come at you, and having a strategy to ensure everyone lives all 10 waves, plus the last wave, the Boss wave. Killing Floor goes on Sale A LOT and you can get the Killing Floor Bundle for 1/2 to 3/4 off.

I bought the Killing Floor bundle on sale for $24.99 and its worth the price. It has just enough DLC and maps in there to make it worth the purchase. I used to play just MW3, and this game gives me a break from the long hours of MW3. The typical Killing floor game lasts from 30 minutes up to maybe 1.5 hours if you choose 10 waves and depends on the difficulty level you choose.

Do yourself a favor after purchasing this game and play it on beginner, solo. You can customize your settings making it easier to remember them all. There are a TON of settings. Set the important ones (especially quick heal) and leave the rest alone.

Overall, I am near/over 120 hours on this game, and its still pretty fun. I have maxxed out a few of the seven perks/characters to level 6 (level 6 is max) and it was a challenge for sure. Some level 6 characters will allow you to spwan in with a weapon and/or carry lot more weight so your weapon selection can do you wonders. The level 6 Medic, Support Specialist and the Firebug on level 6 spawn in with decent stuff. The others I am still working on.

Overall, not too bad a game. The only quirks I have about the gane is that the Listening server doesnt allow you to set a MAX PING, or easily kick problem players. They should allow for IP tracking, latency, and IP blocking for seurity and fair gameplay.

If your looking for a Classic style old-school game that requires a lot of heads up, keep moving action, and has strategies like running to the TRADER to sell weapons that U have found/picked up before the last zombie dies, and then run to cover and come up with a plan of defense for 160+ zombies of different sizes versus 4-5 players, its a hoot, especially on hard, suicidal and hell on earth settings. I enjoy the game, and the duration of each game is just about right. I think you will enjoy Killing Floor as well !

reviewText:
An instant zombie classic. This game brought me together with many friends and introduced me to many other awesome gamers who like to kill zombies. Games can range from short - long, lasting 4 waves - 10 waves, with a Patriarch boss getting his own wave at the end. Similar to L4D, except gameplay is wave based not objective based. However there is an objective play mode with a few maps that are fun as well.

From your basic zombie (referred to as ZEDs in this game) to the intimidating Fleshpound and Scrake, there are many different special zombie types who will all try to eat you in different ways.

There are 7 perk types to play as, from the melee Berserker, to the Medic, to the Sharpshooter, there is likely a class you will really enjoy playing.

Play solo or with a group up to 6, and on custom servers upwards of 30 players on one server.

Many players have created custom maps or objective modes that are unique and fun to play, aside from the 30~ish regular maps, if you like killing zombies, this game can get addicting.

There are 5 difficulty levels, and starting out you really should play on 1/5 - Beginner, because as you level your perks (which level to 6 ((higher on custom servers))) you will become stronger with those weapon types and gain necessary benefits to damage and survival that you need to have for higher difficulties.

After 700~ hours, I've completed all but a handful of maps on 4/5 diff - Suicidal. It's extremely challenging and 5/5 diff is even more ridiculous. If you're good at FPS you will get the hang of it, but like any game, this one in particular takes time and practice.

A great game to play with friends as well, the more perk types your team can cover the better chances you have of surviving, although it is possible to solo most difficulties with any perk, some are more challenging than others. Each perk has a role that they perform and zombies they should focus on taking out, teamwork is key and if you are a lone wolf you can stick with solo.

Still fun after years of playing it. Up there with L4D.

reviewText: Killing Floor is my new favorite horde-based game, that's what you do KF, mow down legions of zombies with your team(under most circumstances). If that concept appeals to you then the rest should even more, there are a variety of enemies to keep you aware from the simple clot to the irritating Sirens as well as the Flesh Pounds. The multiple classes(which are levelable by the way) give you many different approaches to combat zombies, I find the demolition class to be particularily up to my speed. Explosives+zombies= a fun combination. The adjustable difficulty levels add a lot to Killing Floor's replay value, even if you've just started, the beginning difficulty proved entertaining and easygoing as I learned the basic ins and outs of the game.I recommend this game for anyone who's seeking a fun co-op experience and likes killing zombies.

reviewText: On easy mode, it's a fun little co-op shoot-the-things game with waves and a boss. And in-depth character classes. And skills progression. And hilariously bad British voice acting. And totally not zombies. On any harder difficulty, it's an excersize in computer-smashing frustration and shouting matches between teammates while idiots abound trying to tell you exactly how to play their way. On easy mode it's mostly calm and relaxed (relatively, this is a not-zombie game after all) and the most heated it gets is when you get mobbed by fifty things at once (in which case you either a. shoot or stab your way out or b. throw all your grenades at your feet and take all those ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s with you.) On harder modes it's simply a hopeless fight against you with a dinky peashooter (and a lever-action rifle, IF YOU'RE LUCKY...) against bullet-sponge enemies who move at twice your speed and can all but insta-kill you. On easy mode... you know what, I think I've made my point. Get this game.  Play with friends. Or strangers. On easy mode, okay?\n

reviewText:
This is a surprisingly addictive coop, fps, wave-based, zombie survival.

Unlike most games Killing Floor simply acknowledges that it is a game. There are multiple types of zombies with their own unique abilities, but not anything special. The game has a good variety of guns and maps, and a perk-based leveling up tree. The amount of achievements is off the wall. With over 250 of them, it's very hard to get bored of this game.

Now, the only down side to all of these happy notes. DLC. $8 a pop for nothing but a retextures. $8 for a 4-pack of player models, that do nothing but change the way you look. $8 for a 4-pack of golden weapons that are the same as their in-game equivalents. The only thing that may be col is the community weapons pack, but even for a crossbow that shoots rotary saws... Not worth $8.

BUT, that's not an in-game problem, SO BUY KILLING FLOOR NOW!

reviewText: Killing Floor, to me, is one of the best co-op designed games I've played to date. The game brings out all the classic, well-known weapons of shooters into the mix. Killing Floor revolves and works around how many players are in the game (1-6) and each wave of enemies increases in numbers the further you get. The more people that are in the server, the harder the final Patriarch boss is to kill.\n\nThe game has many classes and plenty of characters to choose from and you can level them up from 0-6 as you play them more frequently. If you're looking for a game that has all sorts of classes that master in almost any type of weapon out there, Killing Floor is the game for you. Perfect for when your only objective is to just kill things with your friends!
